titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph Bradley Murray Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Steven Hensen

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 09:03

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: A collection of autograph letters, manuscripts, portraits, and clippings of and relating principally to European and American scientists of the 18th through the 20th centuries. The collector, Joseph Bradley Murray, was a businessman and member of the Class of 1910, Sheffield Scientific School, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph Bradley Murray Collection (MS 363). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: The collection is completely cataloged. Please consult the microfiche index available in the department.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the estate of Joseph Bradley Murray, 1961.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Joseph Bradley Murray Collection consists of autograph letters, manuscripts, portraits, and clippings, of and relating principally to European and American scientists of the 18th through the 20th centuries. The collector, Joseph Bradley Murray (1888-1961), was a businessman and a member of the Class of 1910, Sheffield Scientific School.

Some of the papers originally in this collection have been transferred to other collections in Manuscripts and Archives with which they are more properly connected (e.g. Benjamin Silliman letters were transferred to the Silliman Family Papers, James Dwight Dana to the Dana Family Papers, etc.).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown, though much of the material in this collection is likely in the public domain. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

controlaccess.subject: Science
controlaccess.corpname: Yale University. Sheffield Scientific School. Class of 1910

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following is a detailed list of the individuals represented in this collection. The number in parentheses indicates the number of items relating to an individual; letter "p" indicates there is a portrait or photograph; the letter "c" indicates there is a clipping of some sort.

did.unittitle: Buffon, Georges Louis Leclerc, comte de, 1707-1788 (1-p)
Bunsen, Christian Karl Josias, Freiherr von, 1791-1860 (2)
Chesnel de la Charbouclais, Louis Pierre Fran√ßois Adolphe, marquis de, 1791-1862 (1)
Herschel, Sir John Frederick William, bart., 1792-1871 (3-p)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Co-signer of letter with P. W. Zimmerman.

did.unittitle: Lacepede, Bernard Germaine Etienne de la Ville sur Illion, comte de, 1756-1825 (2)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Two copies of printed notice to John Welsh.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Two copies of letter in folder.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Includes signatures of E.F.W. Alexanderson (transmitted by radio), W.D. Coolidge, Wheeler P. Davey, Irving Langmuir, Charles P. Steinmetz, and W. R. Whitney.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A manuscript described as "a synopsis of an essay by Father John Baptiste Pianciani on the Cosmology of the Ancients."
